page.title: 05ARTS & CRAFTS, DEERNESS (2)
page.content: A joiner makes{brides cogs,}which are traditional{drinking vessels}made from maple wood staved and held with brass hoops and a handle either side. At {weddings}this is filled with hot potent punch and passed around the company. A farmer creates{grandfather {clocks}with cases made from yellow pine veneered with mahogany, dials engraved on brass and the steel pinion works hand made. A retired farmer makes{violins}from well seasoned knot free wood. The bodies are maple; tail pieces, fingerboards and pegs are ebony. He also makes traditional Norwegian{Hardanger fiddles}with carved head pieces. The fronts are decorated with designs hand drawn on the surface with a black pen and inlaid with mother of pearl. He also {composes music and paints}local scenic pictures.
